pcanvas.applet
Class OpenGLApplet

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  processing.core.PApplet
                      pcanvas.applet.OpenGLApplet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants
public class OpenGLApplet
extends processing.core.PApplet

Custom applet used to extract native jogl and gluegen-rt libraries onto the local machine, then load them into the System library path at runtime.

NOTE: This applet should only be extended if the extending applet calls: PApplet.size(int, int, String) where the last parameter is PConstants.OPENGL.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

OpenGLApplet

public OpenGLApplet()
Method Detail

setup

public void setup()
Overriden PApplet.setup() method. Extending applets need to call this in the first line of their own setup methods in order for the extraction to occur properly.

Overrides:
setup in class processing.core.PApplet

setupWeb

public void setupWeb()
Fake setup method. This method is injected by the export script during applet export in order to force this applet to realize that it is being run from a web-platform. Unfortunately due to java applet policies, we are not allowed to retrieve system properites at runtime without requiring the user to have a .java.policy file in their home directory.

This is dangerous because the user may not be familiar with the mentioned policy file(s), and it's a bit annoying as a user to be asked to have to move a file somewhere just to get a piece of code to work. =/

setupEnv

private void setupEnv()
Called from the setup() method. This particluar method is what does all of the heavy lifting during runtime before the applet loads.

In general, it attempts to locate the PCanvasTools-X.X.jar archive, extract the correct system libraries needed for Processing to properly use its OpenGL bindings into a temporary directory, then load those libraries into the java library path at runtime.

extractJars

private void extractJars(java.util.jar.JarFile parent,
                         java.util.jar.JarEntry entry,
                         java.lang.String baseDir)
Extracts an individual jar from the PCanvasTools-X.X.jar file into the users system temp directory. This is necessary as we cannot extract from two levels deep from java.

Parameters:
parent - the parent JarFile containing another JarFile (or JarEntry).
entry - the JarEntry the represents the jar file needing extraction.
baseDir - the base directory location for the parent jar file.

extractNatives

private void extractNatives(java.util.jar.JarFile parent,
                            java.util.jar.JarEntry entry,
                            java.lang.String baseDir)
Extracts the native library binaries ('.dll' for windows, '.so' for *nix and '.jnilib' for OS X) to the file system from a parent jar.

Parameters:
parent - the parent JarFile containing the native needing extraction.
entry - the JarEntry the represents the native needing extraction.
baseDir - the base directory location for the parent jar file.

modifyLibPath

private void modifyLibPath(java.lang.String location)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Modifies the System library.path runtime setting to add our temp directory containing the natives. This is completely necessary, as Processing desperately needs these libraries to access java OpenGL bindings.

Parameters:
location - the location being added to the runtime library path.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if for some reason we are unable to properly modify the library path (permissions or incorrect field handles).
